p:
Target plants were grown spring (March–May) 2018 in a glasshouse at the Institute of Microbiology, Prague, with average day and night temperatures 24 °C and 20 °C, respectively. The day length was extended to 12 h with supplemental lighting (metal halide lamps, 250 W each) providing a minimum photosynthesis flux density of 200 μmol m −2 s −1. Plants were watered daily. From the fourth week after planting F. pratensis, each pot received weekly 65 ml of Long Ashton mineral nutrient solution
70 with the P concentration reduced to 20% of the original recipe
67, 71 .
